channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16284] Unauthorized client can shutdown the cluster
item.description: An unauthorized client can shutdown the cluster as AccessDeniedException is ignored during Admin.stopMaster and Admin.shutdown.
item.summary: Unauthorized client can shutdown the cluster

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

This message was automatically generated.
The failed tests seem to be unrelated to the patch. They passed locally.

The patch looks good.


+    } catch (IOException e) {

+      LOG.error("Exception occurred in HMaster.shutdown()", e);

+      if (e instanceof AccessDeniedException) {

+        throw new ServiceException(e);

+      }

+    }

Could we just throw ServiceException for all IOException ?

Could we just throw ServiceException for all IOException ?

We can do that. I tried not to change the current behavior (log and ignore) for exceptions other than AccessDeniedExceptions.

-1 overall

Another comment.
Can we just replace the existing testShutdown() and testStopMaster() in TestAccessController with your versions, including verifyAllowed() and verifyDenied()?
Thanks.

I replaced the existing testShutdown() and testStopMaster() in TestAccessController with my versions.
However, If verifyAllowed() executed, miniCluster was shutting down. So I was not able to include verifyAllowed().
